quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Season and Player
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, world, gold. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the first Major League baseball player to win the MVP Award two years in a row?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmie Foxx

questions.question: Who was the first Major Leaguer to get more than 160 walks in a season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ted Williams

questions.question: Who was the first pitcher to hit a home run in a World Series game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Bagby

questions.question: What is the first Major League baseball franchise to lose more than 9,000 games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philadelphia Phillies

questions.question: In the Iliad, Homer tells of a wrestling match between Odysseus and whom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Telamonian Ajax

questions.question: World Heavyweight Champion Mike Tyson said that he wore black trunks to symbolize the death of this person.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His trainer, Cus DAmato

questions.question: Three Alou brothers played for the Giants. What were their first names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Felipe, Matty, Jesus

questions.question: What was the name for the first Most Valuable Player Award in Major League baseball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chalmers Award

questions.question: In what year did Babe Ruth hit 60 home runs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1927

questions.question: In a 1942 fight, Tommy Cross entered the ring and then had to suddenly leave. Why?

options.text: He came out for the wrong fight.
The ring was out in the open and it began to rain terribly.
He was not wearing his trunks.
He was in the wrong boxing ring.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was not wearing his trunks.

questions.question: Who was the first player to hit a home run in a World Series game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Sebring

questions.question: Who was the first baseball player to hit more than 40 home runs in a season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babe Ruth

questions.question: This great Ultimate Fighting champion played Gaft in the pilot episode of Blade: The Series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck Lidell

questions.question: Who became the first wrestler to win a gold medal in three different Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aleksandr Medved

questions.question: Which boxer became the youngest world champion in 1976?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wilfredo Benitez

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Pga Championship and Golfer
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, throwback, newman. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the nickname of H.A. Wheeler, the former track promoter at Lowes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Humpy

questions.question: Junior Nation is the affectionate term applied to all NASCAR fans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The PGA Championship is the championship of The PGA Tour Players Association.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In April 1987, this boxer went on a hunger strike for over a month to protest against the conditions for a certain category of boxers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Tyger Trimiar

questions.question: This golf course, the venue for the 2007 PGA Championship, was established in 1936.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Southern Hills, Tulsa Oklahoma

questions.question: Ray Floyd won the PGA Championship two times, the second time at Southern Hills in Tulsa. When and where did this steely-eyed short game master win his first PGA Championship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NCR Country Club, 1969

questions.question: How many times did Tiger Woods win the PGA Championship prior to 2007?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: The first PGA championship was held at Siwonay in New York in 1916 and won by this golfer. The 2006 Championship was conducted at Medinah, and won by this golfer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Barnes/Tiger Woods

questions.question: After many unsuccessful tries, this man in black, also known as The Intimidator, finally won The Daytona 500 in 1998 which was also the track we lost him at.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dale Earnhardt

questions.question: Long before Kevin Harvick won both million dollar events in one season, he was know as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Happy

questions.question: This great golfer never won the PGA Championship, though he came close a couple of times.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greg Norman

questions.question: The golfer who wins the PGA Championship is presented with what trophy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Wanamaker Trophy

questions.question: What is the nickname of Ryan Newman, the winner of the 50th annual Daytona 500, who also has a degree in vehicle structure engineering from Purdue University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rocket Man

questions.question: This is a throwback nickname to Denny Hamlin, the driver of the #11 FedEx Toyota.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hurricane

questions.question: This legendary golfer won the PGA Championship a record-tying 5 times and is third in total major wins behind Jack Nicklaus and Tiger Woods.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walter Hagen

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Player and World Cup
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, stadium, didnt. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This basketball player helped the Knicks win the NBA championship during the 1969-1970 season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willis Reed

questions.question: At the 2006 FIFA World Cup, Italy had a goal disallowed for off side.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: At which stadium was the 2006 FIFA World Cup final held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Olympiastadium (Berlin)

questions.question: This major league baseball player is among the greatest players to ever don a Kansas City Royals uniform.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Brett

questions.question: This football player was a running back for the New England Patriots in the 1980s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Craig James

questions.question: We all know that at the 2006 FIFA World Cup, Italy defeated France in a penalty shoot out, but which Italian player had the honour of holding the World Cup aloft as the winning captain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fabio Cannavaro

questions.question: This NBA player was the 5th player chosen in the 2003 NBA Draft.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dwayne Wade

questions.question: Which player received the Golden Ball award at the 2006 FIFA World Cup finals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zinadine Zidane

questions.question: Women are not eligible to play in the PGA Championship.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which player broke the dead lock with only 2 minutes left of extra time in the Germany v Italy 2006 World Cup semi final?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fabio Grosso

questions.question: Which player was sent off in the 2006 FIFA World Cup quarter final match between England and Portugal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wayne Rooney

questions.question: From 1958, when the PGA tournament became a stroke play event, until 2006, only one person defended successfully his PGA Championship title.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which nation defeated Brazil, the defending champions, in the quarter finals of the 2006 FIFA World Cup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: Which player top scored at the 2006 FIFA World Cup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miroslav Klose

questions.question: Which nation didnt concede a goal in the entire 2006 FIFA World tournament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Switzerland

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Tony Hawk and Game
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, pioneer, game. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the first NFL player to get 200 sacks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bruce Smith

questions.question: Who was the second Major League Baseball switch-hitter to hit 500 home runs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Murray

questions.question: In 1992, Tony Hawk started what skateboard company together with Per Welinder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Birdhouse Projects

questions.question: He was the first African-American to play in the NBA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earl Lloyd

questions.question: Tony Hawk wrote an autobiography, titled Tony Hawk - the Birdman.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Tony Hawk is considered the pioneer of what style of skating?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vertical skating

questions.question: Tony Hawk landed the first ever 900 (two and a half mid-air turns) at the 1999 X Games.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Danny Biasone is often credited with financially saving this professional sport.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Basketball

questions.question: What is the name of Tony Hawks father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Hawk

questions.question: Tony Hawk started skate boarding when he was nine years old.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Scoring a safety is a rare occurrence in an NFL game. This defensive end, who played for the Rams, was the first NFLer to score two safeties in one game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fred Dryer

questions.question: Today in Major League Baseball a ground rule double is when a ball is hit fair, bounces and then goes over the outfield. Which statement is  true about this rule?

options.text: It became a rule when the baseball rules were canonized in 1886.
It was always a rule in the National League but became an American League rule in 1927.
It was made a rule in both leagues in 1919.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It wasnt a rule until 1930.

questions.question: This major league baseball player was easily the best pitcher in the National League in 1986.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Scott

questions.question: What is the name of Tony Hawks son, who was born in 1992?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Riley Hawk

questions.question: This NFL great was the first player to get 14 interceptions in one season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dick Lane

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Baseball and Major Leaguer
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, harris, oneill. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the first Major Leaguer to win the All-Star Game MVP Award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maury Wills

questions.question: In what year were numbers first put on baseball uniforms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1929

questions.question: What baseball player had the first unassisted triple play in a World Series game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Wambsganss

questions.question: Who was the first Major Leaguer to hit 500 homeruns in his career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babe Ruth

questions.question: The 1918 regular baseball season was shortened because of  World War I. What happened in the 1918 World Series, played in September?

options.text: The Chicago Cubs were accused of  throwing the game to the Boston Red Sox.
The Star Spangled Banner was sung for the first time at a sporting event.
The Chicago White Sox were accused of throwing the series.
It was the first World Series that was a best 4 out of 7 series of games.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Star Spangled Banner was sung for the first time at a sporting event.

questions.question: In 1998 this pitcher wore a baseball cap that Babe Ruth had worn in 1920.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Wells

questions.question: Greg Harris and Tony Mullane were both pitchers in Major League Baseball. Why are they significant?

options.text: They were actually the same person.
Babe Ruth hit his first homer off Mullane and Barry Bonds hit his first homer off Harris.
Each one pitched both lefty and righty.
They pitched in the first extra-innings World Series game.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Each one pitched both lefty and righty.

questions.question: Whether fortunately or unfortunately, strikes and work stoppages are a fact of life in professional sports. When was the first NHL player strike?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1925

questions.question: In 1945 catcher Harry ONeill was killed on Iwo Jima. In 1979 catcher Thurmond Munson died in a plane crash. How did catcher Bo Diaz die in 1990?

options.text: Crushed by a cable TV dish

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crushed by a cable TV dish

questions.question: When was the first baseball box score written?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1853

questions.question: This Major Leaguer was the college roommate of the great wide receiver Lynn Swann.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fred Lynn

questions.question: What was the first team to put players names on their uniforms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White Sox

questions.question: Which basketball league was the first to institute a three-point shot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NCAA

questions.question: Who was the first Major Leaguer to hit a grand slam home run in a Major League All-Star game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fred Lynn

questions.question: A player once hit a home run off Jose Cansecos head.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Olympic and Jump
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, sets, stadium. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which score is impossible in a tennis tie-break set?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8-5

questions.question: What does a red flag signal during athletic events that involve a jump?

options.text: The result is not valid because there was too strong back wind.
The result is not valid because the athlete bounced off pass the measure bar.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The result is not valid because the athlete bounced off pass the measure bar.

questions.question: In high jump, how must the bar be attacked for a valid result?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It doesnt matter

questions.question: How many parts are in a basketball game during the Olympic tournament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: Who is a libero in a volleyball team?

options.text: Its the 7th player, allowed to join only if his team trails by more than 8 points
A player that always stands by the net
A player who cannot attack nor block
The play-maker, who passes balls to attacking players

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A player who cannot attack nor block

questions.question: There is some debate as to which city was the first to serve hot dogs at baseball games, but it seems  that one of these two cities was the first.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Louis or New York

questions.question: How many times must athletes circle the stadium in the Olympic 10km run?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 25

questions.question: In soccer, what happens to a goalkeeper who goes outside of his penalty box?

options.text: He is allowed only if his team is defending.
He is allowed to, but he cannot touch the ball with his hands.
His team is penalized by a free kick.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is allowed to, but he cannot touch the ball with his hands.

questions.question: How long is the Olympic cycling race?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is not set

questions.question: How long is a handball Olympic game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 60min, breaks excluded

questions.question: What is part of the result calculation in ski-jumping?

options.text: Distance, but if the jumpers jumped the same distance, style is taken into account

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Distance and style

questions.question: In butterfly swimming, how must the athlete finish the race to have a valid result?

options.text: By touching the pools ending wall with both hands simultaneously
By stepping out of the pool
By touching the pools ending wall with his/her feet
By touching the pools ending wall with with one hand only

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By touching the pools ending wall with both hands simultaneously

questions.question: What object is tossed into the air in the Olympic event Hammer Throw?

options.text: An iron ball attached to a wire

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An iron ball attached to a wire

questions.question: How many sets are played in male table tennis at the Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Up to 7

questions.question: What is the difference between the Olympic and the World Cup soccer tournaments?

options.text: In the Olympic tournament only players under 23 years old are allowed.
Red cards are not used during the Olympic games.
The ball used at the Olympic Games is oval, more like the one used in American Football.
In the Olympic tournament there are no penalty shoot-outs when a play-off match ends in a tie.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the Olympic tournament only players under 23 years old are allowed.
